meanings.definition: A person or thing that precipitates something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was the main precipitators of the science fair success.
meanings.sent2: The new policy was a major precipitators of change in the company.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel turned out to be the unexpected precipitators of the picnic chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter acted as a precipitators for joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The arrival of the famous singer was the much-needed precipitators for the event to be a hit.

meanings.definition: A device used to remove particulates from a gas stream.
meanings.sent1: The air purifier is an effective precipitators in cleaning the indoor air.
meanings.sent2: The factory installed new precipitators to reduce air pollution.
meanings.sent3: The little robot vacuum acted like a tiny, diligent precipitators in keeping the house clean.
meanings.sent4: The umbrella was a protective precipitators against the raindrops.
meanings.sent5: The water filter served as a reliable precipitators in providing clean drinking water.
